note.p: Death: Ferndene, near Gateshead, County Durham (21 April 1889)

Career: Worked in a mercantile office, Dundee; went to London and studied the rapid generation of steam; took out a patent for wire ropes (1840); laid submarine telegraphic cables; invented the brake-drum and cone for deep-sea cable-laying (1853); improved telescopes
Memberships: FRAS (1864); North of England Institute of Mining and Mechanical Engineers; MIMechE
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1889 vol 46 pp xxxiii-xxxv signed by J N L
Notes: E W Cooke has signed election certificate twice
